diagnosis_num_nulls.description: Number of null entries encountered when calculating diagnosis.

social_interaction.description: Social interaction. A component of the scoring system used to assign a diagnosis. Cutoff is 10.

communication.description: Communication. A component of the scoring system used to assign a diagnosis. Cutoff is 8 if verbal and 7 if nonverbal.

restricted_repetitive_behavior.description: Restricted repetitive behavior. A component of the scoring system used to assign a diagnosis. Cutoff is 3.

abnormality_evident_before_3_years.description: Abnormality evident before 3 years. A component of the scoring system used to assign a diagnosis. Cutoff is 1.

A1.description: Failure to use nonverable behaviors to regulate social interaction. Aggregated feature.

A2.description: Failure to develop peer relationships. Aggregated feature.

A3.description: Lack of shared enjoyment. Aggregated feature.

A4.description: Lack of socioemotional reciprocity. Aggregated feature.

B1.description: Lack of or delay in, spoken language and failure to compensate through gesture. Aggregated feature.

B4.description: Lack of varied spontaneous make-believe or social imitative play. Aggregated feature.

B2.description: Relative failure to initiate or sustain conversational interchange. Aggregated feature.

B3.description: Stereotyped, repetitive, or idiosyncratic speech. Aggregated feature.

C1.description: Encompassing preoccupation or circumscribed pattern of interest. Aggregated feature.

C2.description: Apparantly compulsive adherence to nonfunctional routines or rituals. Aggregated feature.

C3.description: Stereotyped and repetitive motor mannerisms. Aggregated feature.

C4.description: Preoccupations with part of objects or nonfunctional elements of material.

Q02.description: Age (in months) when parents first noticed that something was not quite right in language, behavior, relationships

Q04a.description: Coded: Onset as perceived with hindsight

ID.description: Secondary diagnosis of ID (ex. fragile X, speech delay, aphasia)

Seizures.description: Secondary diagnosis of seizures (ex. epilepsy, absence seizures, Landau-Kleffner syndrome)

Tourette or Tic Disorder.description: Secondary diagnosis of Tourette or tic disorder

Mood Disorder.description: Secondary diagnosis of mood disorder (ex. depression, bipolar)

Anxiety Disorder.description: Secondary diagnosis of anxiety disorder (ex. OCD, anxiety, pica)

Autoimmune/Allergic.description: Secondary diagnosis of autoimmune/allergic (ex. asthma, allergies, lactose intolerant)

Behavior.description: Secondary diagnosis of behavior (ex. ADD, ADHD, ODD)

diagnosis.description: Overall diagnosis calculated from combination of instruments.

cpea_diagnosis.description: CPEA diagnosis - combines ADIR and ADOS.

cpea_adjusted_diagnosis.description: CPEA diagnosis - combines ADIR and ADOS. This diagnosis is adjusted to mark true controls (where both ADOS and ADIR agree that this is a control) from Suspected Control (where ADOS and ADIR disagree).
